newsitem.title: THAILAND: Shinawatra unit in Laos telecom deal.
newsitem.headline: Shinawatra unit in Laos telecom deal.

text.p: Thai telecommunication firm, Shinawatra Computer and Communication Plc, said on Monday one of its units has signed an agreement with the Lao government to operate telecommunication services in Laos.

Under the agreement, Shinawatra's international investment unit, Shinawatra International Plc, will set up a joint venture, Lao Telecommunication Co Ltd, with the Laos government, the company said in a statement.
The Lao government will hold a 51 percent stake in the new firm, while the remainder will be owned by Shinawatra International, it said.
The joint venture will operate various services such as mobile phones, fixed-line telephones, international gateway facilities and paging services under the 25-year concession, the company said.
The investment cost of the projects included under the concession is estimated at $400 million, it said.
